title: Teacherforcing model is not working in local (source code download and run in local)
body:
I downloaded the source code "shap==0.40.0 " from github and executed following code.
`from shap1.models import TeacherForcing
from shap1.maskers import Text
from shap1 import Explainer

model = my_model
tokenizer = my_tokenizer
x,y = my_input_data, my_label_data

teacher_forcing_model = TeacherForcing(model, tokenizer)
masker = Text(tokenizer, mask_token = "...", collapse_mask_token=True)
explainer = Explainer(teacher_forcing_model, masker)

shap_values = explainer(x, y)

`



---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
~\AppData\Local\Temp/ipykernel_14156/3224852055.py in <module>
----> 1 shap_values = explainer(x1, y1)

~\Documents\CS701\paper\code\SHAP\origninal_implementation\shap-0.40.0\shap1\explainers\_partition.py in __call__(self, max_evals, fixed_context, main_effects, error_bounds, batch_size, outputs, silent, *args)
    133         """ Explain the output of the model on the given arguments.
    134         """
--> 135         return super().__call__(
    136             *args, max_evals=max_evals, fixed_context=fixed_context, main_effects=main_effects, error_bounds=error_bounds, batch_size=batch_size,
    137             outputs=outputs, silent=silent

~\Documents\CS701\paper\code\SHAP\origninal_implementation\shap-0.40.0\shap1\explainers\_explainer.py in __call__(self, max_evals, main_effects, error_bounds, batch_size, outputs, silent, *args, **kwargs)
    256             feature_names = [[] for _ in range(len(args))]
    257         for row_args in show_progress(zip(*args), num_rows, self.__class__.__name__+" explainer", silent):
--> 258             row_result = self.explain_row(
    259                 *row_args, max_evals=max_evals, main_effects=main_effects, error_bounds=error_bounds,
    260                 batch_size=batch_size, outputs=outputs, silent=silent, **kwargs

~\Documents\CS701\paper\code\SHAP\origninal_implementation\shap-0.40.0\shap1\explainers\_partition.py in explain_row(self, max_evals, main_effects, error_bounds, batch_size, outputs, silent, fixed_context, *row_args)
    151 
    152         # build a masked version of the model for the current input sample
--> 153         fm = MaskedModel(self.model, self.masker, self.link, self.linearize_link, *row_args)
    154 
    155         # make sure we have the base value and current value outputs

~\Documents\CS701\paper\code\SHAP\origninal_implementation\shap-0.40.0\shap1\utils\_masked_model.py in __init__(self, model, masker, link, linearize_link, *args)
     26         # if the masker supports it, save what positions vary from the background
     27         if callable(getattr(self.masker, "invariants", None)):
---> 28             self._variants = ~self.masker.invariants(*args)
     29             self._variants_column_sums = self._variants.sum(0)
     30             self._variants_row_inds = [

TypeError: invariants() takes 2 positional arguments but 3 were given
